projects.title: QuizMaster
description: Software Systems Capstone Project at Lewis University.
Designed, as part of an Agile Scrum team, a comprehensive quizzing application to keep users' minds sharp on various topics.
Redesigned and modernized the front-end application from HTML/CSS/JavaScript to React and Tailwind CSS, optimizing the user experience.
Onboarded and mentored Juniors to develop new features and take over maintenance, ensuring project continuity.

projects.title: In Theaters
description: Mobile Application Development Final Project. Built an Android application for users to see new movies in theaters that week.
Designed the application to display information about a movie, resulting in an experience that allows users to browse any new films and gauge their self-interest.
Integrated Google services for ticket purchases, providing a holistic movie experience.

projects.title: An Agent-Based Model of Environmental Transmission of Clostridioides difficile in Healthcare Settings
description: The Research project started in June 2022. This is an Agent-Based model of C. difficile developed in NetLogo.
The research was conducted with a partner and two faculty advisors.
I have presented the research at the Mathematical Association of America's (MAA)
MathFest
in Philadelphia, PA, the
Symposium on Biomathematics
and Ecology Education and Research at Illinois State University,
the annual meeting of the Illinois State Section of the MAA (ISMAA), and Lewis University's Celebration of Scholarship.
I have won
The Janet L. Andersen Award
for Undergraduate Research in Mathematical or Computational Biology, the Undergraduate Student Poster Session
Outstanding Poster Award
at MathFest, and Outstanding Undergraduate Research from ISMAA, and a finalist for the
Dr. Stephany Schlachter Excellence Award.
Manuscript forthcoming publication in the Journal of Mathematical Biology, 2023.
